title: 2019 Lore Tournament - Day 1: What once Sailed Free vs Aftermath
body:
[](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/esimages/Universe_Explore_BG_orig__3pIBC.jpg)

**Edit: With 30 to 27 votes, "What Once Sailed Free" wins this round!**

#####**_~~Something old, something new~~_**

Welcome, everyone!
The year is coming to an end, and just like last year, I want to honor the epic stories told in the [Universe of Runeterra](https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/explore/everything/newest/) that were released this year. Credit for the idea goes to the lovely [Bioluminescence](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/Wns6RG83-2018-lore-tournament-vote-for-your-favorite-stories-of-the-year) of course, but this time, I'm doing it on my own.

#####**_~~Rules~~_**

Included in the tournament are all _main universe_ stories released this year, as well as **Halfway between the Stars and Earth** and **Demacian Heart** from last December which could not fit into the last tournament. Likewise, if we see new stories towards the end of December, they will probably go into the next tournament. No comics, cinematics or AU stories.
I will use the following format, which will correspond to one battle a day each. I plan for each post to go up around 5 pm CET / 8 am PST; at that time voting for the last post will conclude. 
 ######I'm already late, but let's ignore that. My goal is to get each post out before 6pm.
It's a standard KO-Bracket, so if a story loses, it's out.

#####**_~~A troubled guardian~~_**

The first battle of the tournament revolves around Xin Zhao, the Viscero. 
In our first story, **What Once sailed free**, we learn about how he found new meaning in life after being defeated and ready to die, pledging his life to King Jarvan III of Demacia.
In the second story, **Aftermath**, he reflects on what he could have done to honor this pledge. Was there any way to protect the king from the rebelling mages? In the end, he joins Prince Jarvan IV, apparent heir to the throne.

Hey it's not my fault you guys are putting out so much content.
If I wanted to include AU stories, comics, and even RoR while I'm at it, I would have needed to start in _November_ or even earlier.

Dont read below if u didn't read the stories!!!

Both of the stories were really well written. I think i never knew Xin Zhao till today ( i always told my self he was just he shouting demacian 2.0 xD)

He is a man that felt peace, then pain, fight for survival, lost honor and regained honor... the quintessence of a warrior.
I voted for the first one cos yeah, the second one had more feeling and stuff, but i found similar grevious confrontantions somewhere already.
I found prisoner's figure realyly the original and best attempt to define Xin Zhao as a whole.
They are both really good stories but I had to go with Aftermath since it pushes that original story forward! Though let us not forget we cannot have aftermath without having What Once Sailed Free!
Aftermath in my humble opinion! But hey I have an Anthony Reynolds bias so... :x

What once sailed free -  This story is amazing. I was not sure what it was when I first read the match-up so I read them both again and I must say... There is real emotion, I feel the sincerity of Xin, J3 and even Tianna. A man at the end of his days seeking out some meaning for it all and finding it in the least expected place. It's an amazing story and deserves to progress.

Aftermath - Even though it was written by a different author, I feel a likeness in the way the story was told to the first one. A shared respect for the characters and the world. I felt the loss of a man who had not just lost a beloved master, but a brother and a friend, and the way he assumed that everyone would judge him for not being there just shows the kind of honorable man he is. I couldn't help but think about Azir and Xerath and how the latter forgot his place while Xin remained firm even in his old age, truly a man for Demacian soldiers to aspire to be like. I was not a fan of the fighting and honestly I would have appreciated if that interaction was between Xin and Tianna instead (it's unfortunate a romance didn't develop there over the years... then again, who's to say it didn't? ;) ). I dont like this "Let's continue the war on magic" J4, but I feel that this is just a phase for him (Because shyvanna exists) so not too worried.

I ended up rambling about the second one but that's just because it's current, this is happening here and now and is wide open to speculation and that's exciting for any lore fanatic on here... But I'd have to give my vote to What once sailed free. It's a story that touches the heart, makes you fall in love with J3 and his wisdom and genuine spirit while making you feel passion for Xin, a man who had never known purpose, a man about to die after living an empty life being confronted with destiny and managing to grab hold of his true purpose... it really speak to me personally.

What once sailed free wins, but only slightly. Both stories were massively immersive, and both portrayed xin zhao well. Only reason I think What once Sailed Free wins, is simply preference. I liked seeing Xin Zhao's origins, and seeing how he acted as he did. Here, we are introduced to Xin Zhao's strength, his personality, and his loyalty, and these traits are seen again in Aftermath.


Ahhhh I wish this could end in a draw. These two were some of my favorite stories, its hard to say which is best. 

Still gonna have to What once Sailed Free. Glorious stories on both sides!
Damn its really been a year since the last one. Luckily this one should be more fair since last year had those 2 monsters where icathia once stood and twilight of the gods.
I mean, we do have Silence of the Damned this time around...

These are awesome! I do wonder if Riot actually uses these polls and rankings as an indicator as to what we want to see more or if they more or less proceed with their work regardless of what these yearly reviews show... In any case good job on doing this :D
I hope so! If last year is anything to go by, we'll have more Graham McNeill stories!

Time trully flies, for some reason i thought it was released after The Whispering Doodad

I felt that What Once Sailed Free did a great job of explaining Xin Zhao's background and how it shaped him as a warrior. Aftermath really showed who he is and what he stands for as a loyal Demacian. Not only was the premise of Aftermath better, the writing was way more intense. It had me eager to read more and more as I followed along. I reread it multiple times and would gladly buy a book on the whole Demacian mage war or even just a Demacian family/Xin Zhao biography.

I liked both. I really like the character of Xin Zhao. I think What Once Sailed Free was a little better than Aftermath. But I can't vote for it because it was basically just a rewrite of pre-existing Xin Zhao stories, a small retcon.

It's a shame that All Kindred's Eve isn't in here, I think it would give a lot of these stories a run for their money (although Silence of the Damned and The Echoes Left Behind are admittedly major heavy hitters).

Oh yeah, should have mentioned that. 
No Realms of Runeterra stories either, even though the book is amazing, I want to keep stuff accessible for everyone.
